citation.article-title: Conglomeromonas largomobilis gen. nov., sp. nov., a sodium-sensitive, mixed-flagellated organism from fresh waters.

p.s: Description of Conglomeromonas largomobilis subsp. largomobilis subsp. nov.
Conglomeromonas largomobilis subsp. largomobilis (lar. go. mobi. lis, L. adj. largus in a very slow manner [musical]; L. v. mobilis to move; M. L. adj. largomobilis moving in a very slow manner).
Colonies grown on PYEA are 2 mm in diameter after 72 h of incubation at 28°C, cream to buff in color, opaque, low convex, and round with an entire edge and smooth surface.
Growth is mucoid and easily emulsified.
Cells grown on PYEA are 0.75 to 1 by 3 to 4.5 μm; cells grown on LWA are 1 to 1.5 by 3 to 4.5 μm.
The growth temperature range is 14 to 43.5°C.
Catalase and phosphatase activities are weak.
Acid is produced from mannose, rharnnose, inositol, and lactose.
The G+C contents of the DNAs of strains UQM 2041T and UQM 2043 are 70.2 ± 0.6 mol%, as determined by the thermal denaturation method.
The type strain is strain UQM 2041T, which was isolated from freshwater.
